intro: Onagra jamesii, commonly known as desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, linear leaves and produces small, elongated fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Onagra jamesii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
